primera-infancia.longDescription: We provide comprehensive care for children ages 0 to 5 with early stimulation, play, art, and family support. The program focuses on cognitive, motor, social, and emotional development during the first years of life.

refuerzo-escolar.longDescription: We provide personalized academic support in math, Spanish, science, and other subjects. Our tutors help students improve their school performance, develop study habits, and strengthen basic skills.

danza.longDescription: Our dance program offers training in folk and contemporary dance. Participants develop body expression, coordination, rhythm, and a deep appreciation for Colombian culture through movement and music.

ingles.longDescription: The English program offers language learning as a tool for accessing global opportunities. Students develop comprehension, reading, writing, and conversation skills through dynamic and participatory methodologies.

musica.longDescription: Our music program offers comprehensive training in string, wind, and percussion instruments. Students develop musical skills, discipline, and teamwork through individual and group practice. We have a musical ensemble that performs at community events and festivals.

artes.longDescription: The Arts program offers comprehensive artistic training including visual arts, drawing, painting, and crafts. Participants develop their creativity, expression, and aesthetic sensitivity through individual and collective projects.

escuela-de-artes.longDescription: The School of Arts is an artistic training space that brings together different creative disciplines. Students participate in specialized workshops in visual arts, music, dance, and theater, strengthening their comprehensive artistic education.

tecnologia.longDescription: The technology program offers training in computer tools, basic programming, and digital skills for the 21st century. Students learn to use computers, safe internet practices, and office tools.

biblioteca.longDescription: Our community library is a space for reading, book lending, and reading promotion workshops. Beneficiaries can explore the world through reading, participate in book clubs, and activities that strengthen their reading comprehension skills.

psicologia.longDescription: Our psychology service offers psychosocial support for children, youth, and families. Through individual care, group workshops, and parent school, we strengthen emotional well-being and family relationships.

grupo-mayores.longDescription: We offer recreational, cultural, and wellness activities for senior members of the community. The program includes crafts, adapted physical activity, social gatherings, and support to improve their quality of life.

talleres-para-padres.longDescription: Parent Workshops offer meetings for parents and caregivers on positive parenting, effective communication, school support, and child development. We strengthen family bonds as the foundation of children's well-being.

ropero.longDescription: The community clothing closet receives, organizes, and distributes clothing and footwear donations for community families. This program ensures beneficiaries have access to clothing in good condition.

about.title: About Us
about.heroDescription: More than two decades dedicated to transforming lives through art, education, and culture in one of Bogota's most underserved communities.
about.missionStatement: To provide comprehensive care to children and youth in vulnerable conditions in Ciudad Bolivar, through education, art, culture, and recreation programs, promoting their personal and social development as agents of change in their community.
about.visionStatement: To be a leading organization in the social transformation of vulnerable communities in Colombia, recognized for the quality and impact of its educational, artistic, and cultural programs, and for the formation of citizens committed to social change.

timeline.title: Our Journey
timeline.subtitle: More than two decades of history building dreams and transforming realities in Ciudad Bolívar.

2002.title: Cigarra Foundation is Born
2002.item1: Dr. Carolyn Acosta Allen founds the Cigarra Foundation in response to the displacement crisis in Colombia.
2002.item2: An urgent need is identified in Puertas del Paraíso (Ciudad Bolívar): a safe place for children while their parents work.
2002.item3: With community support and Servivienda, construction begins in May; by August it was finished and in September it opens its doors.
2002.item4: Begins serving approximately 120 children (ages 3 months to 9 years).
2002.item5: Knitting courses for mothers are also launched.
2002.item6: The Foundation secures basic services (water, electricity, sewage) and, together with the community, builds two access staircases.

2002-2003.title: First Support and Social Expansion
2002-2003.item1: Vaccination drives and health brigades are carried out.
2002-2003.item2: For one year, Médecins Sans Frontières provides primary care.
2002-2003.item3: Dental services are offered with volunteers.
2002-2003.item4: The World Food Programme supports with food and supplements in the early years.

2003.title: First Major International Donation
2003.item1: In May 2003, the first major international donation arrives (anonymous benefactor), a support that continues over time.

2009.title: Children's Playground
2009.item1: The children's playground is built together with the community.

2010.title: Technology and Entrepreneurship Training
2010.item1: The "Cigarrita" computer room is remodeled and equipped (donation from IRT, United Kingdom).
2010.item2: A bakery space is rented, with baking and pastry courses (mediated by FUMDIR).

2011.title: Casa Na
2011.item2: The bakery and a nursing station are permanently installed there.
2011.item3: In the previously rented space, a community clothing closet opens (alternative income source).

2013.title: The Malala Room is Born
2013.item1: The Malala Room is created, a space for teenagers (12+ years) during alternate hours.

2014.title: Senior Citizens and Community Works
2014.item1: A senior citizens group is incorporated, strengthening intergenerational exchange.
2014.item2: With the community and Fundación Techo, the main access road to the Foundation is paved.

2015.title: New Dining Hall and Infrastructure
2015.item1: A new dining hall is inaugurated, plus two classrooms, bathrooms, and an administrative office.

2017-2019.title: New Building for Clothing Closet and Music
2017-2019.item1: A three-story building is constructed for the clothing closet and music rooms.
2017-2019.item2: The vision of promoting the music program and a future orchestra is strengthened.

2019.title: Greta Thunberg Building
2019.item1: Recycled containers are acquired and the Greta Thunberg Building (2 floors) is constructed.
2019.item2: The San Jorge Room and the gymnastics room operate there.

2020.title: Racamandaca Mascot
2020.item1: The Foundation adopts its mascot Racamandaca, inspired by "las cigarritas".

2022.title: House Competition and Musical Momentum
2022.item1: The house competition begins (Jaguar, Shark, Caiman, and Condor), inspired by the English model.
2022.item2: The orchestra dream is strengthened thanks to a donation from a major Colombian NGO.
2022.item3: The Foundation's anthem is recorded (December 2022, with Claraluna and music teachers).

2023.title: First Orchestra Concert
2023.item1: The first orchestra concert takes place (June 2023), an institutional milestone.

2025.title: 23 Years of Impact
2025.item1: The Foundation reports over 23 years of service.
2025.item2: It has benefited 1,090 families and 1,877 children and adolescents.
2025.item3: It is consolidated as a benchmark for comprehensive care, education, art, sports, technology, and psychosocial support.

2026.title: San Jorge Room Expansion
2026.item1: The expansion of the San Jorge Room capacity is projected, creating the San Jorgito Room for children ages 6 to 12.

taxDeductible.q: Is my Sponsorship Plan donation tax deductible?
taxDeductible.a: Yes. The Cigarra Foundation is a registered nonprofit with Tax ID 830.114.318-9. All donations are tax deductible in accordance with current Colombian tax regulations. We issue the corresponding certificate for your tax return.

cancel.q: Can I cancel or change my plan at any time?
cancel.a: Yes, you can cancel or change your plan at any time. Simply contact us by email or WhatsApp, and we'll process the change. If you cancel, the child will continue to be served by the foundation with other available resources.

graduation.q: What happens if the child I sponsor graduates or leaves the foundation?
graduation.a: If your sponsored child graduates or leaves the foundation, we'll notify you and assign a new child so you can continue your sponsorship. You can also choose to redirect your contribution to another foundation program.

payment.a: You can pay through our secure DonarOnline platform, which accepts credit cards, debit cards, and bank transfers. We also offer the option of donating in US dollars for international sponsors.

visit.q: Can I personally meet the child I sponsor?
visit.a: Yes, we organize annual events where sponsors can visit the foundation and meet their sponsored children. You can also arrange a visit on business days by contacting us in advance.

percentage.q: What percentage of my donation goes directly to the child?
percentage.a: 100% of your donation goes directly to the foundation's programs. Administrative expenses are covered by corporate partnerships. We publish annual financial management reports for full transparency.
